column2: Your Ruler has decided to abdicate the throne to you...
Your Heir has accepted the throne.

The mediterranean traders have accepted our proposal and signed a five-year agreement that should fill our treasury with taxes and valuable goods from all over the known world. They took our gold and promised to return in a few months fully loaded.
Good. They better keep their word.

Trading routes with the Mediterranean Sea have been established in [Root.GetName]. Ships full of valuable goods from Cyprus, Rome and Constantinople are expected to visit our port every month. This will provide a steady tax income for the next five years.
The costs of a court can be a heavy burden, one that must be born by the host.
